sentence.Network_en: Research has revealed him to be [ that he was ] a hermit.
sentence.Network_cn: 调查结果表明他原是一位隐士.

sentence.Network_en: The cave was inhabited by a hermit.
sentence.Network_cn: 以前曾有一个隐士居住在这个洞穴里.

sentence.Network_en: The hermit followed an ascetic life - style.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个隐士过的是苦行生活.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French hermite, from late Latin eremita, from Greek erēmitēs, from erēmos 'solitary'

entry.def: A hermit is a person who lives alone, away from people and society.

means.word_mean: 1. one retired from society for religious reasons

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"……人"; 2. 表抽象名词

stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+cru成长+it……人→n.新兵,新分子,新会员 v.补充,征募,征募新兵,复原

stems_affixes.value_cn: 赤字,逆差;亏损,亏空;不足,缺乏
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉,不+fic做+it-it,表抽象名词→做得不够→亏空;不足
pursue追赶+it-it,表抽象名词→n.追赶,追求;职业,工作
spir呼吸,精神+it-it,表抽象名词→n.精神;志气;[n.]情绪,心情;[n.]酒精

stems_affixes.value_cn: 补充,征募,征募新兵,复原

cred信任+it表抽象名词→ v.信任;学分

means.word_mean: (尤指早期基督教的)隐居修道士; 隐士; 遁世者

sentences.en: The cave was inhabited by a hermit.
sentences.cn: 以前曾有一个隐士居住在这个洞穴里。

jushi.english: The cave was inhabited by a hermit in the 19th century.
jushi.chinese: 19世纪时有一位隐士曾住在这个洞穴里。

jushi.english: In the ancient China,hermits usually lived in hamlets.
jushi.chinese: 在古代中国，隐士们通常都住在小村子里。
